entry.title: Azerbaijani soldier detained in Armenia after crossing border

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijani soldier detained in Armenia after crossing border
media:group.media:description:
๐Armenian authorities arrested one Azerbaijani serviceman today after he apparently crossed into Armenian territory from the Azerbaijani exclave of Nakhichevan. The search for a second Azerbaijani soldier who also is alleged to have crossed the border continues. ๐The head of Armeniaโs Security Council, Armen Grigoryan, met yesterday with Iranโs powerful National Security Council head, Ali Shamkhani, in Tehran. ๐Armeniaโs Prosecutor General, Anna Vardapetyan, formally asked parliament for the go-ahead to bring criminal charges against opposition lawmaker Mher Sahakyan for allegedly assaulting ruling party lawmaker Mher Sahakyan during a hearing.

media:group.media:description:
Arun Venkataraman, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Global Markets and Director General of the U.S. and Foreign Commercial Service, sat down with CivilNetโs Mark Dovich to discuss efforts to advance commercial ties between the United States and Armenia, deepen the two countriesโ civil nuclear cooperation, and promote the regionโs economic prosperity.

entry.title: Business Week Armenia: Preparatory work underway on partial border reopening with Turkey

media:group.media:title: Business Week Armenia: Preparatory work underway on partial border reopening with Turkey
media:group.media:description:
In this weekโs edition of CivilNetโs business digest:
๐The Armenian government is beginning preparatory work to ensure that customs procedures can be applied on the Armenia-Turkey border if or when it is reopened. ๐Russiaโs food safety agency, Rosselkhoznadzor, formally banned Armenian dairy products after previously saying it was considering such a move. ๐Artyom Shamtsyan, Chief Innovation and Digital Innovation Officer at Ameriabank, sat down with us to talk about the potential of Armeniaโs digital transformation. ๐Victoria Aslanian, CEO of Golden Grape ArmAs, joined us in our studio to discuss her life journey and how she helped create one of Armeniaโs leading wineries.

entry.title: Armenia to participate in US-led military exercises this year

media:group.media:title: Armenia to participate in US-led military exercises this year
media:group.media:description:
๐Armenian servicemen will participate in two U.S.-led military exercises in Europe later this year, according to Aram Torosyan, the spokesperson of the Armenian Defense Ministry. ๐Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed Azerbaijanโs ongoing blockade of the Lachin corridor and other recent developments in Russian-Armenian relations in a telephone conversation today. ๐Pashinyan also received a U.S. delegation to discuss deepening cooperation between the United States and Armenia in energy, trade and investment.

media:group.media:title: Armeniaโs ArmAs works to revitalize countryโs storied wine culture
media:group.media:description:
โIn terms of winemaking, we couldnโt have made up a better story than the one that we have.โ That is how Victoria Aslanian, CEO of Golden Grape ArmAs winery, describes Armeniaโs storied history of wine production. Victoria sat down with CivilNetโs Mark Dovich to talk about her journey from Yerevan to Los Angeles and back, how she helped create one of Armeniaโs leading wineries, and the challenges โ and opportunities โ of being a woman business owner in Armenia.
